errors.durationOrder: Optimistic time should be less than most likely time, and most likely time should be less than pessimistic time
errors.optimisticTooHigh: Optimistic time cannot be greater than most likely time
errors.mostLikelyRange: Most likely time must be between optimistic and pessimistic times
errors.pessimisticTooLow: Pessimistic time cannot be less than most likely time
errors.activityHasDependents: This activity is depended on by: {{activities}}

whatIsCPM.question: What is Critical Path Method (CPM)?
whatIsCPM.answer: Critical Path Method is a project management technique that identifies the longest chain of activities and calculates the minimum completion time of the project.

whatIsPERT.question: What is PERT Analysis used for?
whatIsPERT.answer: PERT (Program Evaluation and Review Technique) analyzes project durations with optimistic, most likely, and pessimistic estimates, calculating the probability distribution of project completion time.

howToStart.question: How can I get started?
howToStart.answer: You can start a new project from the Dashboard page, add your activities, and define dependencies. Then the system will automatically calculate the critical path.

canIExport.question: Can I export my project data?
canIExport.answer: Yes, you can export your projects in Excel format and save your reports as PDF.
